com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveFunctionIf

public interface XhiveFunctionIf

Represents a function object. Classes implementing this interface can be used to traverse and modify DOM tree structures.
Function objects are always used in combination with methods traversing data.

The use of function objects enables separation of traversal methods and function methods. Also, it enables reuse of function classes.

An XhiveFunctionIf object is used in combination with traversal methods provided in XhiveNodeIf.

In general, the traversal method calls the function object methods. The function object is processed in 3 steps:

  1. The traversal method calls the function isDone to check if the traversal is to continue or finish.
  2. The traversal method calls the function test to check if the process function is to "process" the node.
  3. The process function executes the "action" on the data.
(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Method Summary
 boolean isDone(Node node)
          Returns true when the traversal method that is processing the function object can terminate traversal.
 void process(Node node)
          Executes the actual processing of the node.
 boolean test(Node node)
          Returns true when the process function is ready to process the specified node.
 

Method Detail

isDone

boolean isDone(Node node)
Returns true when the traversal method that is processing the function object can terminate traversal.

Parameters:
node - the current node of the traversal method.
Returns:
true when the traversal method that is processing the function object can terminate traversal.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

test

boolean test(Node node)
Returns true when the process function is ready to process the specified node. This method filters the nodes to be processed.

Parameters:
node - the current node of the traversal method.
Returns:
true when the process function is ready to process the specified node.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Executes the actual processing of the node.

Parameters:
